entry.title: one single glimpse of relief
entry.summary:
Author: greyspilot

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 64,396Chapters: 12/20Kudos: 148

Summary: "What if I never get better? What if I always feel like this?" Buck finally looks back up at him, vulnerability and compassion clear on his too-expressive face. "I don't know," he says honestly. "I don't‚Ä¶" he shudders, gives a tiny shrug of his shoulders and tries again. "I don't have an answer for that, man. It's been seven months for me and I still feel‚Ä¶like this." "Like what?" Buck just shrugs again, then mumbles, "Not myself." And Eddie doesn't know what to say to that either, because this is the only version of Buck he's ever known.Or: Buck and Eddie meet at grief group.

entry.title: Last chances and second glances
entry.summary:
Author: thebookofcrows

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 153,697Chapters: 45/60Kudos: 843

Summary: St. Anthony‚Äôs was his last chance, and Evan knew that. He had been kicked out of five schools in the past six years, and after his sophomore year ended with a meeting between his parents and his last headmaster that could be summarized with: ‚Äúwe‚Äôre not kicking him out, but just know that Evan is not welcome back in September.‚Äù His parents wanted to send him to military school. ¬† ¬† ¬† Evan knew he couldn‚Äôt survive military school, that would be his last drop, the one that finally shattered the vase. He couldn‚Äôt be the type of person that would be able to put himself back together once they broke him down. ¬† ¬† This had to work. . . . Buck is the new kid in an El Paso boarding school, trying his best to stay out of trouble. Eddie is a rockstar (in the world of high school popularity) he's captain to the football team, he's dating the most popular girl in school, and looking at a full ride sports scholarship in the fall. He should feel like he won at life, which is why he doesn't understand why the only time he feels alive is when he catches a glimpse of the new guy on the running team. Or in simpler terms: Buddie high-school AU!

entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 739,068Chapters: 77/?Kudos: 107

Summary: Bobby and Athena are just two people trying to put their lives back together while figuring out how to co-parent. What starts as a complicated plan to foster kids in need slowly turns into something much deeper. Through the ups and downs of heartbreak, healing, and raising children who‚Äôve been through so much, they find strength in each other. Over time, their partnership grows into love, and together, they build a story about family, trust, and second chances.

entry.title: Evergrowing
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 514,084Chapters: 70/?Kudos: 29

Summary: Athena and Bobby are learning that parenting doesn‚Äôt end when the kids turn eighteen. With three grown children and two still at home, Bobby and Athena find themselves navigating new challenges at every stage of life. Each child carries their own struggles, some spoken and some hidden, but together the family works through the ups and downs with love, patience, and resilience. At the heart of it all, they‚Äôre reminded that family is a bond that grows, shifts, and deepens, no matter how old the kids get.

entry.title: What a night to forget.
entry.summary:
Author: Absolute_Maniac

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 20,924Chapters: 11/?Kudos: 140

Summary: ‚ÄúHey, can you see my phone anywhere?‚Äù he asked. Eddie started looking around the bed and then stretched himself to his side of the bed and pulled it from the nightstand.‚ÄúHere.‚Äù He tossed it to him, and Buck immediately started looking through recent pictures on his phone. Pictures of them partying, a video of Eddie taking a shot, and another video of Eddie dancing.Then he came across the next picture and felt as if someone had thrown a bucket of ice water over his head. They must have asked someone else to take the picture because it was taken from at least a two-meter distance. The two of them were holding out a piece of paper towards the camera‚Ä¶ and they were pressed together in a passionate kiss.Buck looked up from the picture when Eddie made a strangled sound on the other side of the room. ‚ÄúYou might want to see this‚Ä¶‚Äù He reached over with a piece of paper in his hand. Buck took it and turned his phone over to him in return. Eddie bit into his fist as he studied the picture. Buck looked down at the paper in his hand and turned it over to the right side. It was a copy of a marriage license for Mr. Evan Buckley-Diaz and Mr. Edmundo Buckley-Diaz.

entry.title: Not in the way you want (Or is it?)
entry.summary:
Author: Nostalgic_Cassette

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,262Chapters: 1/6Kudos: 8

Summary: Eddie's always felt different about Buck. It's not like the way he felt about Shannon, or Adriana, or even Chimney. It's unique. It's all consuming and makes him feel soft and sweet on the inside, no matter how cliche that may sound. He revels in the fact that Buck seems right. Buck seems like his best friend. His insanely hot, highly distracting, strictly platonic, best friend.Oh shit.OR5 times Eddie ignores the signs + 1 time he embraces them."You know you could have called me right? Just as much as you're there for me and Chris, we're here for you too."Buck huffs a laugh, and Eddie hears the keys to his car jingling in the background."I know, I know. I guess I just didn't want to bother you or anything.""You're not a burden, Buck. You're my best friend, and that's what we do. We show up for each other. We got each other's backs, remember?" Eddie assures firmly, understanding where Buck was coming from but also realising that in all honesty, it was a whole load of crap."Yeah. Yeah I know." Buck almost whispers, and something about his tone makes Eddie's heartbeat skip, blush heating his cheeks.

entry.title: Gardens Are a Cut Throat Business [so is love]
entry.summary:
Author: sassay

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,389Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 33

Summary: Eddie stares at the massive display in front of him in horror. How are there so many different kinds of fertiliser? And of course Pepa isn't answering his calls to ask which one she wants for her roses. Eddie closes his eyes and pinches the bridge of his nose. Evan didn't become a firefighter, instead he studied horticulture and botanicals, starting his own business in sustainable, green landscaping. He meets Eddie having a crisis in the fertiliser section of the local nursery and things grow..Buck loves his new house, his landscaping skills come in handy as he completely reworks his bare yard. His neighbours seem nice too - Chris is inquisitive and clever and his step-mum, Carla is friendly as well. An alternative universe meet-cute and slow burn romance along with missed moments, arguments, misunderstandings and a series of events where no one realises that Evan and Buck are the same person also known as the Gardener Buck AU.

entry.title: A Soft Place After The Storm
entry.summary:
Author: LightMoth

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,368Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 79

Summary: ‚ÄúI had a nightmare,‚Äù Buck admits, shrugging like it‚Äôs nothing. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs fine. I‚Äôm used to it.‚ÄùEddie‚Äôs jaw tightens before he asks: ‚ÄúWhy didn't you wake me?‚ÄùBuck clings to his coffee and shakes his head immediately. ‚ÄúNo. You were exhausted. We'd had that shift with back-to-back calls.‚Äù‚ÄúAnd?‚Äù Eddie raises an eyebrow and sets his mug down. ‚ÄúSo what?‚ÄùBuck blinks at him. ‚ÄúSo‚Ä¶ you needed sleep.‚ÄùEddie leans forward, forearms on his knees, looking at him like he‚Äôs trying to make sure Buck really hears him. ‚ÄúIf you have a nightmare, I want you to wake me up. Okay?‚ÄùBuck huffs a soft laugh. ‚ÄúEddie, it‚Äôs not a big-‚Äù‚ÄúIt is to me.‚Äù Eddie reaches out, curls his fingers around Buck‚Äôs hand and strokes over the back of it. ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt have to handle that alone. I want to be there, that‚Äôs kind of the whole point.‚Äù _______ Buck has learned early to deal with nightmares by himself. Now that he's in a relationship with Eddie he sleeps next to someone who claims to want to be woken up for it. Buck is torn between his habits and hesitant trust.

entry.title: Catch Me, Please

Author: ALittleSideProject

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 62,026Chapters: 17/34Kudos: 182

Summary: And all of that was why, on their seventeenth day on Mars, Buck had shoved Eddie out of the way during the emergency evacuation, knowing it meant his own death instead of Eddie‚Äôs. Buck trusted Eddie to help get everyone else home, and Eddie had someone to go home for. Someone who needed him and loved him. Someone who Buck loved, even without ever meeting. He wasn‚Äôt going to let Chris grow up without a father. So in the split second he had to think after seeing the communications dish flying at them through the storm that was chasing them off the planet fourteen days early, he‚Äôd pushed Eddie out of the way, hoping like hell it would be enough and knowing he wouldn‚Äôt live long enough to find out. -- Or, when their mission to Mars goes wrong, Buck gets stranded and the rest of the crew does everything they can to save him. | Fic is complete at ~120k words and posting 2-3x a week as I edit.
